claim: Flublok (quadrivalent) was evaluated in the pivotal trial against Fluarix (quadrivalent standard-dose vaccine).

combined_evidence.quote: Two large studies have explored rVE of recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4). The Medicare beneficiaries study [10] using retrospective data as described above, reported significant rVE of RIV4 vs. SD-IIV4) against influenza related hospital encounters. Secondly, a randomized controlled trial (RCT) found significant rVE of RIV4 compared with SD-IIV4 among adults 50 years old, but not for adults 65 years old [11].
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote explicitly states that a randomized controlled trial (RCT) compared the recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4, which is Flublok) with the standard dose quadrivalent influenza vaccine (SD-IIV4), supporting the claim that Flublok (quadrivalent) was evaluated in a pivotal trial against a standard-dose quadrivalent vaccine.

combined_evidence.quote: SD-IIV4 included Afluria, Fluarix, FluLaval, Standard Dose Fluzone and FlucelVax. HD-IIV4 was High Dose Fluzone, RIV4 was Flublok and Adj-IV was FluAd.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote clarifies the vaccine brands used in the study, confirming that Flublok refers to RIV4 and that Fluarix is one of the standard dose quadrivalent vaccines (SD-IIV4), directly supporting the claim about the specific vaccines compared.

combined_evidence.quote: c RIV4: Flublok. c SD-IIV4: Afluria, Fluarix, FluLaval, Standard Dose Flu zone and FlucelVax.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote explicitly identifies Flublok as RIV4 and Fluarix as one of the SD-IIV4 comparators, directly supporting that Flublok (quadrivalent) was evaluated against Fluarix (quadrivalent standard-dose vaccine) in the study.
